title: About
text: Xingyuan Zhao’s website for EPPS 6356 Data Visualization

title: About This Course
text: Welcome to EPPS 6356 - Data Analysis, a comprehensive course designed to equip students with modern data analysis skills using cutting-edge tools and technologies.

title: About This Course
text:
Learning Objectives
By the end of this course, you will be able to:

Analyze Data: Apply statistical methods to real-world datasets
Visualize Information: Create compelling data visualizations
Build Reports: Generate reproducible research documents
Collaborate Effectively: Use version control and modern development workflows

title: About This Course
text:
Course Structure

Module 1: Foundations

Introduction to Quarto
R programming basics
Data manipulation with tidyverse



Module 2: Visualization

ggplot2 fundamentals
Interactive visualizations with plotly
Dashboard creation



Module 3: Statistical Analysis

Descriptive statistics
Hypothesis testing
Regression analysis



Module 4: Advanced Topics

Machine learning basics
Web scraping
API integration

title: About This Course
text:
Tools & Technologies



Core Tools

Quarto: Document generation
R/RStudio: Statistical computing
Git/GitHub: Version control
VS Code/Cursor: Modern IDEs




R Packages

tidyverse: Data manipulation
ggplot2: Visualization
shiny: Interactive apps
knitr: Report generation

title: About This Course
text:
Example: Loading and Exploring Data
Let’s look at a simple example using the course dataset:


Code
# Load required libraries
library(tidyverse)
library(DT)

# Check if file exists and load it
if (file.exists("tophat_grade.csv")) {
  grades <- read_csv("tophat_grade.csv", show_col_types = FALSE)
  
  # Display first few rows
  datatable(head(grades, 10), 
            options = list(pageLength = 5, 
                          scrollX = TRUE),
            caption = "Sample of TopHat Grades Data")
} else {
  cat("Data file not found. Using example data instead.\n")
  
  # Create example data
  example_data <- data.frame(
    Student_ID = paste0("S", 1001:1010),
    Score = round(rnorm(10, mean = 85, sd = 10), 1),
    Grade = sample(c("A", "B", "C"), 10, replace = TRUE, prob = c(0.4, 0.4, 0.2))
  )
  
  datatable(example_data, 
            options = list(pageLength = 5),
            caption = "Example Student Data")
}
